{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acromegaly is a hormonal disorder that develops when the pituitary gland produces too much growth hormone during adulthood. This excess growth hormone causes the bones to increase in size over time, especially those of the hands, feet, and face. In terms of dental effects, acromegaly is associated with mandibular overgrowth, which leads to prognathism, or an extended lower jaw. This condition is classified as a Class III malocclusion.", "answer_choice": "D. Class. III malocclusion"}
